Posts.Content: I get mine free on prescription! Huge bottle too. Little known fact that it is available on the NHS. Janet x
Posts.Title: Cheap Bio Oil

Posts.Content: http://www.breastcancer.org/symptoms/diagnosis/margins   This explains the margins x
Posts.Title: No clear margins!

Posts.Content: Phew! Glad it's not just me then! I would walk to the ends of the earth for my lovely consultant!! *-* xxx
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, Laughing at you post! Especially Mr Baboob!  I am so glad I didn't offend anyone with this discussion..we all need a bit of light relief in amongst all the serious issues! I love my team too, and tell anyone who'll listen how fabulous my consultant is!! Good luck with your surgery. Love Janet :)
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: I have been told this is perfectly normal as they are like hero's who save our lifes...would be interested in your thoughts!
Posts.Title: Did anyone else develop a teensy consultant crush during their treatment...

Posts.Content: Hi Sonia,  I am over the worst of my cancer as had a mastectomy with reconstruction in November and have had 3 weeks of radio. The doctor removed 4 nodes and only found cancer in one of them , so no Chemo was needed luckily enough. How are you coping with Chemo?? I'll bet it is exhausting? Take care Janet xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee, Nice to meet you. Like the sound of a meet up. You are quite a distance away though!  Janet xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: I am from Glenrothes, in Fife, Scotland, and wondering if there are any ladies from the same area who have battled with breast cancer too?? Janet xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: I'm experiencing life after too! Lets be friends on Facebook then, I am more likely to see private messages on there. Will PM you with my details Janet xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Have sent you a friend request through here Dorothee, if you accept then I can PM you. Janet x
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi Kathleen, I have lots of friends from all over the place, but thought it would be good to meet women from Scotland who have been through, or are going through this too. All the best for your treatment. I have had a sentinel node biopsy and mastectomy< and am here to support you. Janet xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi Amber, Totally agree with you about drawing inspiration from all ladies on here. The support is fantastic!! I had a mastectomy in November last year after being diagnosed with stage 2 oestrogen driven cancer. I had reconstruction at the same time and have just finished 3 weeks of radiotherapy. I am also on Letrozol. I am so grateful for my routine, aged 50, mammogram! Janet xx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi Sonia, Glad to hear it wasn't as bad as expected. I'm on Letrozol for 5 years, they give me sore knees and hot flushes, but it's a small price to pay for keeping safe xxx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: Hi all, I have made a couple of lovely connections through this post, none from my area, but I'm sure we will all meet up when all treatment is finished. I'm so sorry to hear about your mum Lindie. Hopefully it's been caught early? It's often in the back of my mind about it coming back on the other side, but as I had the cancer unknowingly for 2 years (doctor's estimate) then I'm sure my check ups will catch it earlier this time and I won't (hopefully) need such drastic surgery as the first time xxx
Posts.Title: Any Scottish ladies out there?

Posts.Content: I don't think it will settle as it looks like it should be plumped up! There is a saggy loose bit at the bottom too :( My other recently uplifted/ reduced breast is so beautiful. Am I being a bit moany wanting the other to match it a bit better? Janet xx
Posts.Title: I have a new nipple on my implant (reconstruction) but I now have...

Posts.Content: I have recently had nipple reconstruction and am very impressed with how realistic it looks! However I now have a sort of sunken hollow area to the top side of my breast. It's probably because the skin had to be pulled over. Has this happened to anyone else? Will my surgeon correct this? I'm going back in 5 weeks but am really curious as to whether he will correct it and how? Thanks in advance. Janet x
Posts.Title: I have a new nipple on my implant (reconstruction) but I now have...

Posts.Content: Hi Marie. I was on the brand Teva for over a year and it was the best one for me. However, my local chemist then started to give me Zentiva and it gave me crippling joint pain (even with supplements, which I take to counteract the side effects). I shopped around and have now found a chemist which supplies Sandoz and I find the joint pains are mostly in the morning now and bearable. Hope this helps. Janet x
Posts.Title: Letrozole question..

Posts.Content: Thanks for answering my query Debra. Sounds like you recovered well from the op, so it makes me hopeful that I will do the same. I am physically quite fit which should help. Love  Janet x
Posts.Title: I am booked in for my uplift/reduction on good side. What is the recovery...

Posts.Content: Hi there,  I am booked in for an uplift/reduction on good side and nipple recon on my recon side. Can anyone tell me how quickly they recovered from this op (nurse told me 4 weeks) as I have an important event to attend a week after it and wonder if I will be able to cope with it. Thanks Janet x
Posts.Title: I am booked in for my uplift/reduction on good side. What is the recovery...

Posts.Content: Dorothee you are wonderful! You have hit so many nails on their heads with your answer to this question. Isn't it odd how people react to us?! I don't know if it's a Scottish thing but I keep getting asked how I'm 'keeping'. Apart from swallowing half a ton of supplements to counteract the sore joints that good old Letrozole gives me, I am in fact usually physically more fit than the people who ask me that question...and some of them are half my age!! I have come to appreciate my body more and (when not recovering from surgery) I love nothing more than swimming 50 lengths of my local pool or going for a brisk 3 mile power walk!  I have never felt so alive! But if I gave this as my reply then I would get odd looks!! Much love and respect Janet xx
Posts.Title: What do i say? Odd question i know....
